Outside.Body: You are underwater, the ring is in the castle but there's also a shipwreck over there.

Choices.Text: Return to the surface with the ring

Castle Entrance Room.Body: The entrance to the castle, which welcomes its guests with its title: 'Chariot Isle Castle: Home of the King of the Sea'. There's an opening in the floor that leads to another room.

Middle Floor.Body: You swim down into the bottom floor, beneath you is endless darkness. On the side, a shimmer of light comes through from an archway, the throne room.

Throne Room.Body: You enter the throne room. On the throne is a corpse, with its head slouched to the side, hair spread, wavy, but stiff in the still water. Cracks in the ceiling let glimpses of light in, illuminating the room.

King Corpse.Body: It's a corpse, of what seems like a king. He wears a rather simple ring, gold with a ruby in a bezel. Remarkably, the ring's shine has persisted over many years, standing out against the corpse's other jewelry.

King Corpse Dissolved.Body: The corpse dissolves into the surrounding water, leaving no trace except for the singular ring which remains suspended in front of you.

Deep Chasm.Body: You swim down into the darkness, your movement disrupts the water that had been stagnant in this chasm for god knows how long. In the darkness, a glimmer, a key.

Shipwreck Deck.Body: You swim towards the shipwreck. Small bits of algae try to grow on the cedar wood, but the lack of light at this depth makes their life a struggle. There's a helm on the far edge of the deck, and a door below it to the cabin. The cabin door is locked; you'll need to find a key to open it.

Helm.Body: You swim past a mast labeled 'N' to reach the helm of the ship. It's delicately carved out of cedar, accented with one silver knob, pointing up towards the mast in front of you. A silver 'S' is stamped on the deck below your feet.

Shipwreck Cabin.Body: You swim into the cabin. You see writing etched into the wall, and a little trapdoor in the corner of the room.

Writing on the Wall.Body: Sloppily carved into the wall of the ship's cabin is an unfinished message: 'I’m lost. Directionless in my search for the king of the sea. Lost faith from my crew. I know now that there is no destination, and no other choice but to give up. I just wish he could hear my last words: _________'

Full Writing on the Wall.Body: Sloppily carved into the wall of the ship's cabin is the COMPLETE message!: 'I’m lost. Directionless in my search for the king of the sea. Lost faith from my crew. I know now that there is no destination, and no other choice but to give up. I just wish he could hear my last words: Take me Neptune, my love. Drown me in your brine. Let it poison my body like your allure poisoned my mind.'

Storage Room.Body: It's a storage room flooded with brine. There's junk everywhere, but only a couple things catch your eye. There's a prison cell on one side, with a journal kept on the wall behind the bars. There's also a statue labeled 'Nerites', displaying a man reaching out with one finger in front of the rest.

Choices.Text: Place the ring on the statue

Prison Journal.Body: The journal reads: 'Day 1: I overhear that the captain has set course for Chariot Isle, East of here. We should arrive in a few days. Day 5: According to the crew, the captain has gone mad, and we are now circling this damned isle, looking for something. Day 8: The captain has given up, perhaps too early, and we now set sail northwest, indefinitely. Day 9: By the captain's sabotage, this ship keeping me captive slowly sinks. While the crew escapes, I must patiently await for the rising waters to drown me. It seems the captain will do the same, while reaching towards the sky, begging that someone points his vessel in the right direction.'

Surface Ending.Body: You get to the surface and you got the ring and you get money hooray

Statue Ending.Body: The statue dissolves with the ring on it. Things feel at peace. You return to the surface without the ring.
